comments.text:
To fetch data from supabase, you have to write a javascript function using the Noodl.Variables.supabase client.

With Noodl AI, you can create a function with the following prompt as a base to work on :
"Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table companies"

(which gave te result in the function node below)
Creates the Supabase client and stores it in a Noodl Variable
Set the localstorage keyName to save the AuthSession
Set the user profile table name

comments.text: 'currentUser' can be reused as id in an Object  node anywhere in the project to make these properties available

⚠️ The sendPasswordResetEmail function does not provide a success response only when the user exists; it's designed to return a success response even if the email is not associated with any user, to prevent enumeration attacks where an attacker could use this function to discover valid email addresses. Firebase's behavior is to silently fail, meaning it does not disclose whether an email is linked to an existing account or not, for privacy and security reasons.

parameters.format:
Password reset link emailed to {email}
If you did not receive it, please verify the email address.

parameters.text:
1. Verify it
2. Log in on this page

parameters.format: A verification link was emailed to: {userEmail}

comments.text: We output the array 'providerData' from the object

roots.label: create User With Email And Password

comments.text: Creates the firebase instance and stores it in a Noodl Variable

HEAD PAGE SETUP
In your Project settings sidebar, Custom Code section, add the below Head Code:

<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-firestore.js";

  // Expose Firebase init and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
<script>
  window.validator = validator;
</script>
Set the localstorage keyName to save the AuthSession
Set the user profile table name

parameters.values: Text box visible,Invalid email,User  not found,Pwd reset eml send fail,Email address required

comments.text: Available for internal logging purposes, monitoring user behavior or troubleshooting issues, while the "User not found" message is not directly exposed to the end user.

parameters.value-Failed-Failed upd: Email update failed, please try again

settings.headCode:
<script type="module">
  import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-app.js";
  import { getAuth, createUserWithEmailAndPassword, signInWithEmailAndPassword, onAuthStateChanged, sendEmailVerification, sendPasswordResetEmail, updateEmail, updatePassword } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-auth.js";
  import { getFirestore } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/10.7.2/firebase-firestore.js";

  // Expose Firebase initialization and auth functions to the global scope
  window.initializeApp = initializeApp;
  window.getAuth = getAuth;
  window.createUserWithEmailAndPassword = createUserWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.signInWithEmailAndPassword = signInWithEmailAndPassword;
  window.onAuthStateChanged = onAuthStateChanged;
  window.sendEmailVerification = sendEmailVerification;
  window.sendPasswordResetEmail = sendPasswordResetEmail;
  window.updateEmail = updateEmail;
  window.updatePassword = updatePassword;
  window.getFirestore = getFirestore;
</script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/validator/validator.min.js"></script>
<script>
  window.validator = validator;
</script>
